item.title: Emergency Fund
item.description: The Emergency Fund (EF) is a group of investments with next-day liquidity and negligible risk. For convenience, the Emergency Fund is assumed to match the part of the portfolio for inflation protection and risk free bonds because these are usually composed of D+1 liquidity government treasuries.

item.title: Financial Independence
item.description: Financial Independence means that money should not get in the way of reasonable quality of life decisions. This is a naturally vague definition because it requires a bit of common sense and a moving target for one’s standards of living. At the very least, it should include the possibility of giving up income for a few years (making it possible to exchange professions) or completely retiring if expenditures are considerably reduced.
